content.raw:
The issue of BLACS blocking when sending messages to child processes that have died is a [bug in zmq](https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/issues/179) as far as I can tell. We could work around it, but let’s see if the zmq people say anything about it before doing anything.

terminating the worker being a synchronous operation that runs in the GUI thread is a bad idea now that \`.terminate\(\)\` can be blocking, I will work out how to move that into the event loop so that failure can be caught properly and not block the GUI.

And surprisingly, I think those two issues \(plus making the server terminate its subprocesses upon exit\) might be almost it for making remote process breakage handled about as sensibly as local ones.
